alert.note: Alert for Warren (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 9:49PM EDT until further notice by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schroon River At Riverbank. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Water reaches moderate flood stage. Water surrounds several homes on Schroon River Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:31 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 7.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:31 PM EDT Sunday was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise to 8.0 feet Tuesday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Schroon River Riverbank Flood Stage: 7.0 Observed Stage at Sun 9 pm: 7.6 Forecast: Mon 2 am 7.6 Mon 8 am 7.5 Mon 2 pm 7.5 Mon 8 pm 7.6 Tue 2 am 7.6 Tue 8 am 7.8 Tue 2 pm 7.9 Tue 8 pm 8.0 Wed 2 am 8.0 Wed 8 am 8.0 Wed 2 pm 7.9 &&
